guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

body:
Pretty much, the ones that ruin the platforms are the far-right and far-left, any far side of political spectrum just spells bad news and ends up just being a game of 'who can say the worst shit to each other' 

I do hope they enforce the rules they have laid out, at the moment things seem to be okay and I'm happy here.

body:
I'm looking to start a guild. Just have to grind the rep. I was on voat during pre alpha (or was it beta?) when it was called whoaverse. It reminded me a lot of this place. Felt the same. In the beginning people were cordial and normal. Then the violent mentally disturbed people came and started threatening violence and nothing was done. Now its filled with a lot of vileness. It was nice in the beginning just like here.

If it does turn out the same then I guess I'll leave and if not then I'll stay.
body_html:
I'm looking to start a guild. Just have to grind the rep. I was on voat during pre alpha (or was it beta?) when it was called whoaverse. It reminded me a lot of this place. Felt the same. In the beginning people were cordial and normal. Then the violent mentally disturbed people came and started threatening violence and nothing was done. Now its filled with a lot of vileness. It was nice in the beginning just like here.

If it does turn out the same then I guess I'll leave and if not then I'll stay.

body:
I think the main issue is the question of what is freedom of speech and it's a hugely controversial question. Differentiating the trolls and those who legitimately want to discuss is difficult too.

If you try stop them from going nuts and posting threats and baseless insults around they just throw up the 'freedom of speech' card and then try to say they are being censored.

People that moved from reddit to here just wanted more freedom, they didn't want to join some political nightmare, those already exist and are even brought up by them sometimes. If you like it so much then just use it, doesn't really make sense why they say that (platform) is better than ruqqus. Ok then, go join that one?

Really, I think the main reason people left are.
- You were barely able to post anymore due to the fact moderators ensured themselves and their mates were the only ones who could get their posts to the top.
- All the major subreddits were moderated by a few individuals, some redditors modded over a thousand subreddits.
- You couldn't have a conversation about anything that was considered to be 'politically incorrect'
- Subs that were just minding their own business and didn't do anything wrong were just being slammed and censored.
- Code of Conduct was an absolute travesty and literally says that you can be racist to 'the majority' aka trying to say white people, without saying it. If you are going that blunt just put white people.

The last one personally was the straw that broke the camels back for me.
body_html:
I think the main issue is the question of what is freedom of speech and it's a hugely controversial question. Differentiating the trolls and those who legitimately want to discuss is difficult too.

If you try stop them from going nuts and posting threats and baseless insults around they just throw up the 'freedom of speech' card and then try to say they are being censored.

People that moved from reddit to here just wanted more freedom, they didn't want to join some political nightmare, those already exist and are even brought up by them sometimes. If you like it so much then just use it, doesn't really make sense why they say that (platform) is better than ruqqus. Ok then, go join that one?

Really, I think the main reason people left are.

  • You were barely able to post anymore due to the fact moderators ensured themselves and their mates were the only ones who could get their posts to the top.
  • All the major subreddits were moderated by a few individuals, some redditors modded over a thousand subreddits.
  • You couldn't have a conversation about anything that was considered to be 'politically incorrect'
  • Subs that were just minding their own business and didn't do anything wrong were just being slammed and censored.
  • Code of Conduct was an absolute travesty and literally says that you can be racist to 'the majority' aka trying to say white people, without saying it. If you are going that blunt just put white people.

The last one personally was the straw that broke the camels back for me.

body:
I do agree with you the moderation of reddit and its arcane abusive rules caused me to leave for the reasons you listed. However not having a strong stance against calls for violence I believe will turn this site into a voat clone.

I actually want this site to thrive not languish. Constantly seeing calls to violence will drive well adjusted mentally intact people away. These people are lifeblood to a social site like this one......

If you try stop them from going nuts and posting threats and baseless insults around they just throw up the 'freedom of speech' card and then try to say they are being censored.

People that moved from reddit to here just wanted more freedom, they didn't want to join some political nightmare, those already exist and are even brought up by them sometimes. If you like it so much then just use it, doesn't really make sense why they say that (platform) is better than ruqqus. Ok then, go join that one?

Really, I think the main reason people left are.

  • You were barely able to post anymore due to the fact moderators ensured themselves and their mates were the only ones who could get their posts to the top.
  • All the major subreddits were moderated by a few individuals, some redditors modded over a thousand subreddits.
  • You couldn't have a conversation about anything that was considered to be 'politically incorrect'
  • Subs that were just minding their own business and didn't do anything wrong were just being slammed and censored.
  • Code of Conduct was an absolute travesty and literally says that you can be racist to 'the majority' aka trying to say white people, without saying it. If you are going that blunt just put white people.

The last one personally was the straw that broke the camels back for me.

post.body: Specifically the constant calls of violence against people. It's evil. I really hope this place bans calls for violence against people and doesn't let it slide.
post.body_html: Specifically the constant calls of violence against people. It's evil. I really hope this place bans calls for violence against people and doesn't let it slide.
post.title: Hope this place doesn't become like Voat

body: Time will tell. The admins and Guildmasters need to be on guard. Ruqqus is now a growing competitor to Reddit, and I have no doubt that both they and the idiotic vandals at Voat, and I'm sure other corners of the Internet that I'm not aware of, would dearly love to sabotage this experiment. There are fine lines involved, and it will take a great deal of fortitude and adult maturity to keep this site from veering off into one swamp or another. We shall see.
body_html: Time will tell. The admins and Guildmasters need to be on guard. Ruqqus is now a growing competitor to Reddit, and I have no doubt that both they and the idiotic vandals at Voat, and I'm sure other corners of the Internet that I'm not aware of, would dearly love to sabotage this experiment. There are fine lines involved, and it will take a great deal of fortitude and adult maturity to keep this site from veering off into one swamp or another. We shall see.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

parent.body:
I'm looking to start a guild. Just have to grind the rep. I was on voat during pre alpha (or was it beta?) when it was called whoaverse. It reminded me a lot of this place. Felt the same. In the beginning people were cordial and normal. Then the violent mentally disturbed people came and started threatening violence and nothing was done. Now its filled with a lot of vileness. It was nice in the beginning just like here.

If it does turn out the same then I guess I'll leave and if not then I'll stay.
parent.body_html:
I'm looking to start a guild. Just have to grind the rep. I was on voat during pre alpha (or was it beta?) when it was called whoaverse. It reminded me a lot of this place. Felt the same. In the beginning people were cordial and normal. Then the violent mentally disturbed people came and started threatening violence and nothing was done. Now its filled with a lot of vileness. It was nice in the beginning just like here.

If it does turn out the same then I guess I'll leave and if not then I'll stay.

post.body: Specifically the constant calls of violence against people. It's evil. I really hope this place bans calls for violence against people and doesn't let it slide.
post.body_html: Specifically the constant calls of violence against people. It's evil. I really hope this place bans calls for violence against people and doesn't let it slide.
